markdown: ITC Limited REPORT AND ACCOUNTS 2013 ITC's Brands: An Asset for the Nation The consumer needs and aspirations they fulfil, the benefit they generate for millions across ITC's value chains, the future-ready capabilities that support them, and the value that they create for the country, have made ITC's brands national assets, adding to India's competitiveness. It is ITC's aspiration to be the No 1 FMCG player in the country, driven by its new FMCG businesses. A recent Nielsen report has highlighted that ITC's new FMCG businesses are the fastest growing among the top consumer goods companies operating in India. ITC takes justifiable pride that, along with generating economic value, these celebrated Indian brands also drive the creation of larger societal capital through the virtuous cycle of sustainable and inclusive growth. NEW AASHIRVAAD ATTA MULTIGRAINS Nourishment for all ages GREAT TASTE RICH IN option PROTEIN: [x] option DIETARY FIBRE: [x] option VITAMINS: [x] option MINERALS: [x] A A QUALITY PRODUCT FROM ITC LIMITED A 100 Inspiring Years fiama DI WILLS LOVE DELIGHTFULLY SOFT SKIN? GET INDIA'S FIRST GEL BAR WITH SKIN CONDITIONERS It has Moisture Lock for softness round the clock. SKIN CONDITIONERS fiama Gel LABORATOIRE NATUREL INNOVATIONS IN SKIN CARE #BeYOUNG Dark Fantasy <::An advertisement for "Dark Fantasy Choco Fills" with a coffee flavor. The image features a large, dark, coffee bean-shaped chocolate with a creamy filling visible, surrounded by several smaller chocolate pieces. The background is dark with a subtle grid pattern and some abstract circular designs. Text on the image reads: "Dark Fantasy Choco Fills Coffee" and a question "Coffee? Chocolate? Or both?" Below the main visual, it says "Escape into one." In the top right corner, a small, partially visible logo or text includes "#Be". : advertisement::> <::An advertisement featuring a woman with long dark hair, looking towards the viewer, with her arms crossed over her chest. To her right, there is text that reads: "Cell renew" Below this, in larger font, it says: "fight skin damage at the cell level" And in smaller text below that: "with Bio-Active Cell Repair™" In the bottom right corner, there are five white bottles of cosmetic products of varying sizes, arranged on a surface. In the top right corner, there is a small logo that appears to be a stylized 'A' with "100" below it. : advertisement::> <::logo: BINGO! IRRESISTIBLE TASTES & COMBINATIONS IN SNACKING The logo features the word "BINGO!" in bold, stylized text with a 3D effect, enclosed within an oval shape, followed by an exclamation mark.::> <::A black and white photograph featuring a man and a woman, likely a fashion advertisement. The man is on the left, wearing a fedora hat, a light-colored jacket over a plaid shirt, and trousers. The woman is on the right, wearing sunglasses, a patterned dress, and carrying a handbag. In the top-left corner, there is a small inset image of a bottle. In the bottom-right corner, a logo reads "WILLS LIFESTYLE". : figure::> <::An image showing a hand holding a notebook. The notebook has "CLASSMATE" written diagonally across its cover. In the background, more notebooks are visible. At the top left, there's text that appears to say "Funk & Freestyle". At the bottom right, a logo with the word "CLASSMATE" is present. : figure::> Source: https://www.industrydocuments.ucsf.edu/docs/snbx0223

chunks.markdown: ITC's Brands: An Asset for the Nation

The consumer needs and aspirations they fulfil, the benefit they generate for millions across ITC's value chains, the future-ready capabilities that support them, and the value that they create for the country, have made ITC's brands national assets, adding to India's competitiveness.

It is ITC's aspiration to be the No 1 FMCG player in the country, driven by its new FMCG businesses. A recent Nielsen report has highlighted that ITC's new FMCG businesses are the fastest growing among the top consumer goods companies operating in India. ITC takes justifiable pride that, along with generating economic value, these celebrated Indian brands also drive the creation of larger societal capital through the virtuous cycle of sustainable and inclusive growth.
